newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain says domestic demand growth continued in Q2.
newsitem.headline: Spain says domestic demand growth continued in Q2.

text.p: Spain's domestic demand continued to grow during the second quarter, the Economy Ministry's monthly report on Economic Indicators said on Tuesday.
"Recent indicators show a continuation of the expanding economic trend seen in the National Quarterly Accounting Report in the opening quarter", the report said.
Exports were also performing positively, "allowing net external demand to provide a sustained positive contribution despite a growth in imports", it added.
Personal spending is being aided by the "favourable development of real income" as a result of the increase in employment, a fall in inflation and improved family sentiment.

Real wage indicators for the private sector, calculated on the basis of agreed salaries and Social Security affiliations, grew 5.6 pct year-on-year in the second quarter, nearly two percentage points higher than in the opening quarter.
The Ministry also said the average price differential with the three best placed EU countries was 1.1 percentage point.
"One can foresee a reduction when figures for the next few months are added, guaranteeing the fulfilment of the Maastricht criterion based on annual figures", the report said.
